me.adaptive.arp.api

Interface IService

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IAdaptiveRP, IBaseCommunication

    public interface IService
extends IBaseCommunication
    Interface for Managing the Services operations
    Since:
    v2.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  IService.CertificateValidation
      Type of certificate validation for a given service endpoint - this flag is used for SSL/HTTPS connections to provide an additional level of security.
      static class  IService.ContentEncoding
      Enum to define the content encoding for service requests and responses
      static class  IService.Method
      Http method type.
      static class  IService.ProtocolVersion
      Protocol version.
      static class  IService.Type
      Type of available services

    • Method Detail

      • isServiceRegistered

        boolean isServiceRegistered(java.lang.String serviceName,
                            java.lang.String endpointName,
                            java.lang.String functionName,
                            IService.Method method)
        Checks whether a specific service, endpoint, function and method type is configured in the platform's XML service definition file.
        Parameters:
        serviceName - Service name.
        endpointName - Endpoint name.
        functionName - Function name.
        method - Method type.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the service is configured, false otherwise.
        Since:
        v2.0.6

      • getServicesRegistered

        ServiceToken[] getServicesRegistered()
        Returns all the possible service tokens configured in the platform's XML service definition file.
        Returns:
        Array of service tokens configured.
        Since:
        v2.0.6

      • getServiceToken

        ServiceToken getServiceToken(java.lang.String serviceName,
                             java.lang.String endpointName,
                             java.lang.String functionName,
                             IService.Method method)
        Obtains a ServiceToken for the given parameters to be used for the creation of requests.
        Parameters:
        serviceName - Service name.
        endpointName - Endpoint name.
        functionName - Function name.
        method - Method type.
        Returns:
        ServiceToken to create a service request or null if the given parameter combination is not configured in the platform's XML service definition file.
        Since:
        v2.0.6

      • getServiceTokenByUri

        ServiceToken getServiceTokenByUri(java.lang.String uri)
        Obtains a Service token by a concrete uri (http://domain.com/path). This method would be useful when a service response is a redirect (3XX) and it is necessary to make a request to another host and we don't know by advance the name of the service.
        Parameters:
        uri - Unique Resource Identifier for a Service-Endpoint-Path-Method
        Returns:
        ServiceToken to create a service request or null if the given parameter is not configured in the platform's XML service definition file.
        Since:
        v2.1.4

      • getServiceRequest

        ServiceRequest getServiceRequest(ServiceToken serviceToken)
        Create a service request for the given ServiceToken. This method creates the request, populating existing headers and cookies for the same service. The request is populated with all the defaults for the service being invoked and requires only the request body to be set. Headers and cookies may be manipulated as needed by the application before submitting the ServiceRequest via invokeService.
        Parameters:
        serviceToken - ServiceToken to be used for the creation of the request.
        Returns:
        ServiceRequest with pre-populated headers, cookies and defaults for the service.
        Since:
        v2.0.6

      • invokeService

        void invokeService(ServiceRequest serviceRequest,
                   IServiceResultCallback callback)
        Executes the given ServiceRequest and provides responses to the given callback handler.
        Parameters:
        serviceRequest - ServiceRequest with the request body.
        callback - IServiceResultCallback to handle the ServiceResponse.
        Since:
        v2.0.6
